content:
PacketCaptureFilter Class

Definition

Filter that is applied to packet capture request. Multiple filters can be applied.

In this Article

public class PacketCaptureFilter
Inheritance
Object
PacketCaptureFilter

Constructors

PacketCaptureFilter()

Initializes a new instance of the PacketCaptureFilter class.
PacketCaptureFilter(String, String, String, String, String)

Initializes a new instance of the PacketCaptureFilter class.

Properties

LocalIPAddress

Gets or sets local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5"? for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.
LocalPort

Gets or sets local port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.
Protocol

Gets or sets protocol to be filtered on. Possible values include: 'TCP', 'UDP', 'Any'
RemoteIPAddress

Gets or sets local IP Address to be filtered on. Notation: "127.0.0.1" for single address entry. "127.0.0.1-127.0.0.255" for range. "127.0.0.1;127.0.0.5;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.
RemotePort

Gets or sets remote port to be filtered on. Notation: "80" for single port entry."80-85" for range. "80;443;" for multiple entries. Multiple ranges not currently supported. Mixing ranges with multiple entries not currently supported. Default = null.
